Posts.Content: kita wrote: On Oct 15 I will be 25 yay me.... I should be celebrating but instead I just want to break all the mirrors in my house and hide shirtless in the dark. My chest wall tumors have decided to work their way to the surface, two ugly bulges where I used to have sexy cleavage a few yrs ago. Navelbine did nothing to stop this cancer which makes it the 3rd straight regimen to have failed. I am waiting on news if I got into a PARP trial at NIH in Bethesda, Md which I feel could be my only hope to reverse this. My second option is a trial at my cancer center that blocks the blood vessels to the tumor. Sounds like a good idea but its given without chemo which makes me nervous. I have been depressed lately because only a few shirts cover these ugly tumors and when I cover them they start to get irritated by the shirt so I can't win :-( "... I dare not linger, for my long walk is not yet ended.”--- Nelson Mandela Dx 10/15/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 10/19/2010 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel), Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Gemzar (gemcitabine), Ixempra (ixabepilone), Navelbine (vinorelbine), Taxol (paclitaxel), Xeloda (capecitabine) Surgery 6/2/2011 Mastectomy: Left, Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: tumors showing, chemo not working, turning 25 kita barsco1963

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2012 09:42PM kita wrote: Thank you all for the love and support. I think if I wasn't trying to get on a trial maybe they would do radiation. I will ask at my next appt. the cd of my last pet scan got overnight fed ex'd today to the trial people so I hope to hear from them by Friday. Then I still have 2 more weeks to wait before I can start. Soliel the trial is 7 days of PARP and one day of carboplatin. I've had Carbo before and it was the last chemo that worked in a yr so I hope it does the job again with a little help from oliparib. My parents are coming for my birthday and I booked us a two our cruise of San Diego bay. Hoping I can just enjoy myself. My treatment center is doing a project to do genetic tests on all tumors if possible to try to find any markers that might lead to new medicines out there for me. My request for that biopsy has been submitted already.

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2012 07:30AM kita wrote: I think they won't remove the tumors because they are connected to tumors behind the chest wall that can't be taken out surgically. I think my chances are good for getting on the trial because they just asked for my new scans and didn't say there wasn't a spot open. I just hate waiting around. Don't they know it drives us crazy!
Posts.Title: tumors showing, chemo not working, turning 25 kita barsco1963

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2012 12:30PM kita wrote: I had my biopsy done this morning and got some lidocaine cream to put on my tumors to numb them during the day. Ugh the sound of the biopsy made my husband get chills but luckily I didn't feel a thing. It's possible for TN to changs receptors. I feel like its asking for a miracle but I'm praying I'm in that group! My Dr spoke with the clinical trial people and they are still reviewing my scans. Why they need to see the actual scan before letting me on the trial is beyond me but that's the way it goes. If I am accepted I will start Oct 22. After my first trip out there I'm planning on moving home with my parents for a few months to make the babysitting situation easier. Fingers crossed the biopsy and trial bring me good news. It's been since Feb that my Dr has had anything positive to tell me.
Posts.Title: tumors showing, chemo not working, turning 25 kita barsco1963

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2012 12:34PM kita wrote: The nurse who did my biopsy is the same one who used to do my expander fills last yr. he told me I'm the bravest patient he knows because I always keep looking for the next thing to help and not give up. After all the patients they see, it was good to hear that. I don't always feel brave but I know I'm a long way from throwing in the towel.
Posts.Title: tumors showing, chemo not working, turning 25 kita barsco1963

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2012 08:39PM kita wrote: I think I'm going to name my tumors and paint faces on them so I can talk to them in the mirror. Then maybe when I pass away the cause of death will be psychosis not cancer.

Posts.Title: Some inspiration kita bhd1

Posts.Content: kita wrote: I'm on a little vacation back home in Northern New Mexico and it just makes me feel better. Today I took my daughter to watch our friends rope cattle and of course age was wearing her cowgirl boots and hat. She rode with one of the girls and looks like a pro, a 2.5 yr old equestrian pro! She sits straight up, holds the reigns with one hand and waves with the other. It just melts my heart to see her so happy. It makes me feel like I'm not sick and like someday I might see her be rodeo queen. Even though I myself never had any interest in cows and horses or much of the outdoors. My dr also found me a parp trial that will actually accept me with all my past chemos so the arrangements ate being made for me to go there and do the trial. Finally I feel like there is hope. Being BRCA2 positive plus the parp and carbo, shoot those cancer cells better start dying! Just wanted to share my good news. Wish you ladies were all my friends on Facebook so u could see my daughters pics and videos from today. If anyone wants to add me just send me a pm and I'll give u my Info to find me "... I dare not linger, for my long walk is not yet ended.”--- Nelson Mandela Dx 10/15/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 10/19/2010 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel), Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Gemzar (gemcitabine), Ixempra (ixabepilone), Navelbine (vinorelbine), Taxol (paclitaxel), Xeloda (capecitabine) Surgery 6/2/2011 Mastectomy: Left, Right Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Celebrities and BC smiley2 DivineMrsM

Posts.Content: kita wrote: Background story. I waited 4 months to find a Parp trial that would accept when there was an opening. Once that day came we thought we were set. Then I waited 5 weeks for an interview to see if I was accepted getting weaker by the day. The next week I was accepted and flew back for my first cycle. The first cycle astounded everyone. The biggest tumor on my chest completely flattened. Then some shrinking some to be growing. I came for found ; with high hope done it was the same medicine order as the 1st cycle. But my scans were mixed and my counts kept me here a week. Went home with blood and platelet transfusions and a wound vac for the hole in my chest . I started feeling crappy on Thursday but just tried to rest. It was a rough flight back to Md but I made if only to be told my loss of breath was concerning. Something white that could infection or tumor. Other tumor sights show growth despite not even missing a whole cycle. So until they can get me home with oxygen I'm stick here again. My dr suggested hospice when I get back. I suggest no way ! My onc has to have more tricks up her sleeve. "... I dare not linger, for my long walk is not yet ended.”--- Nelson Mandela Dx 10/15/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 10/19/2010 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel), Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Gemzar (gemcitabine), Ixempra (ixabepilone), Navelbine (vinorelbine), Taxol (paclitaxel), Xeloda (capecitabine) Surgery 6/2/2011 Mastectomy: Left, Right Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: kita wrote: Hi ladies I feel like I've been on so many chemo medicines but still not NED. First it was Taxol/ Avastin, then A/C then clear until 4 months later when they found lung mets. Next wad Gem/Carbo with a study drug until my counts went too low too many times. Sad to get off study vecause it had gitten rid of lung mets and jept the rest stable. Then we tried Ixempra/xeloda which didn't work and now I just started Abraxane. Has anyone else been on several chemo drugs searching for that perfect one to get you to NED? "... Posts.Content: kita wrote: When I was growing up my mom always shared get favorite memories about my grandma. She had passed away years before I was born but my mom wanted me to know what a good relationship they had. Her fondest memory was staying home from school to lie in bed with my grandma who worked nights as a nurse. She also had severe diabetes and my mom was always by her side and loved taking naps with her. Now that I am sick I find myself in the same position. I love staying in bed late because my medicines make me drowsy and because I just don't have anything that important to get up for. I love having my little princess by my side cuddling and watching tv with me. I wonder if she will remember our lazy times together as fondly as my mother has. Judy sharing something that popped into my head. Hope you all ate feeling well and you cancers are running away. "... I dare not linger, for my long walk is not yet ended.”--- Nelson Mandela Dx 10/15/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 10/19/2010 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel), Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Gemzar (gemcitabine), Ixempra (ixabepilone), Navelbine (vinorelbine), Taxol (paclitaxel), Xeloda (capecitabine) Surgery 6/2/2011 Mastectomy: Left, Right Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2012 07:04PM kita wrote: My mom is convinced that b17 will cure my cancer. She read a book called A World Without Cancer and believes its all a conspiracy. I'm her only child so I can see why she desperately thinks I'll be cured one day. Just to make her happy and because I thought what the hell it couldn't hurt, I started taking b17 vitamins. However, I will not go to a clinic in Mexico (which the book talks about) that pumps you full of vitamins and says that some regimen can cure any type if cancer. Smh I want to believe it can help but I just don't know.
